meta.scene_intent: Legendary quality elemental sword inspired by Thunderfury, Blessed Blade of the Windseeker. The most coveted weapon in classic WoW — a blade of pure elemental fury, crackling with chain lightning, its form partially dissolved into living storm energy. The orange legendary glow must scream 'once in a lifetime drop.' This icon should make any WoW veteran feel a rush of nostalgia and envy. The weapon transcends mere steel — it IS the storm.

usp_core: Direct reference: World of Warcraft inventory icon art style — single item rendered in painterly digital style on dark gradient background
Quality tier: Legendary (orange) — item border glow color #ff8000, the rarest and most prestigious tier in WoW's item quality system
Design inspiration: Thunderfury, Blessed Blade of the Windseeker — the most iconic legendary weapon in WoW history, elemental storm sword
Rendering: hand-painted digital icon with maximum detail, energy effects, and dramatic lighting — this is the showcase piece

subjects.element: Elemental storm sword crackling with lightning — legendary quality (Thunderfury-inspired)
subjects.details: A breathtaking elemental sword approximately 110cm in total length, its form existing at the boundary between physical weapon and living storm. The blade is an elongated, slightly curved single-edged form with a dramatic forked tip that splits into two prongs like a lightning bolt frozen in metal. The lower two-thirds of the blade is forged from dark teal-blue storm-metal — an alloy that seems to contain swirling cloud patterns within its surface, as if a thunderhead was compressed into steel. The metal has a wet, electrically charged sheen. The upper third of the blade transitions from solid metal into crackling, arcing electrical energy — the steel appears to dissolve into pure lightning, with jagged bolts of cyan-blue electricity (#00ccff) leaping between the two forked blade tips and arcing outward into the surrounding air. The transition zone where metal becomes energy is the most visually intense area: white-hot (#ffffff) at the conversion points, surrounded by branching electrical fractals. Small chain-lightning arcs continuously jump from the blade to the crossguard, from the blade tip into empty air, and between the forked prongs. The crossguard is a sweeping angular form of the same storm-metal, shaped like swept-back wind or stylized lightning bolts, with its tips crackling with small electrical discharges. The grip is wrapped in a material that appears to be woven from metallic storm-grey threads, and it vibrates with visible electrical energy running through it — tiny arcs of lightning visible crawling along its surface. The pommel is an orb of contained ball lightning — a sphere of roiling blue-white electrical energy held in place by a cage of storm-metal wire, constantly flickering and pulsing, the most intense small light source on the weapon.
subjects.scale: Weapon fills approximately 80% of the square frame, oriented diagonally — the forked blade tip and electrical arcs extend the weapon's visual footprint beyond the metal form

camera.shot_type: Flat icon view with slight 3/4 angle — standard WoW inventory icon perspective
camera.angle: Very slight 3/4 rotation (approximately 10-15 degrees) to showcase the forked blade tip depth and the ball-lightning pommel dimensionality
camera.lens_equivalent: Orthographic / flat projection — no perspective distortion, game UI icon convention
camera.focal_point: The transition zone where solid blade dissolves into pure lightning energy — the most visually spectacular area of the weapon
camera.depth_of_field: Infinite — everything in perfect focus, but the electrical arcs have natural motion blur from their rapid flickering
composition_rules: Weapon centered in frame, filling approximately 80% of the square canvas
Diagonal orientation lower-left to upper-right — forked lightning-blade tip reaching toward upper-right, ball-lightning pommel anchoring lower-left
Electrical arcs extend beyond the weapon silhouette into the surrounding dark space, making the weapon feel alive and dangerous
The brightest point (metal-to-energy transition) positioned near the visual center-upper area of the composition
Dark gradient background dramatically illuminated by the weapon's own electrical discharge
Single weapon only — no hands, no characters, no environmental context
Clear silhouette readable at 80x80 — the forked tip and electrical arcs create an unmistakable shape

lighting.key_light: The weapon IS the light source — electrical energy from the blade provides the overwhelming majority of scene illumination, casting intense cyan-blue-white light in all directions, creating a dramatic rim-light effect on the dark storm-metal portions of the weapon
lighting.fill_light: Orange legendary glow (#ff8000) from behind the weapon as a warm backlight, mixing with the blue electrical light to create dramatic color contrast — warm orange halo behind, cool blue-white electrical light in front
accent_lights: Chain lightning arcs — bright cyan-blue (#00ccff) with white cores (#ffffff), 6-8 visible arcs leaping from the blade at various points, each one a small concentrated light source
Ball-lightning pommel — intense flickering blue-white sphere that pulses and strobes, casting dynamic light onto the grip and lower crossguard
Forked blade tip electrical discharge — the brightest area, white-hot (#ffffff) where the two prongs arc between each other with continuous branching lightning fractals
Legendary-quality orange glow (#ff8000 at 35-40% opacity) as a strong warm backlight halo around the entire weapon silhouette — the most intense quality aura of any tier
Electrical corona — a pale blue ionization field (#80d4ff at low opacity) surrounding the entire blade, visible as a soft electrical haze
lighting.shadows: Minimal traditional shadows — the weapon produces so much light that it overwhelms most shadow areas. Where shadows exist (behind the crossguard, under the grip wrapping), they are deep teal-blue. The interplay of warm orange backlighting and cool blue-white electrical front-lighting creates complex color-shadow interactions on the storm-metal surfaces.
atmospheric_fx: Dark gradient background: radial gradient from #0a1520 at center to #050a10 at corners, dramatically illuminated by the weapon's electrical discharge — the background is alive with reflected blue light

Chain lightning arcs: 6-8 crackling electrical bolts leaping from the blade surface into the surrounding air, each with a bright white core surrounded by cyan-blue glow, branching into smaller fractal tendrils — these extend beyond the weapon silhouette
Electrical corona: a soft luminous haze of ionized air (#80d4ff at 15-20% opacity) surrounding the entire blade, creating an electrical field effect
Orange legendary border glow (#ff8000 at 35-40% opacity) around the weapon's outermost silhouette edge — strong, warm, unmistakably legendary tier
Tiny electrical sparks and motes floating in the air near the blade — scattered cyan-white points of light
Ozone distortion: very subtle wavy heat-distortion-like effect near the most intense electrical areas, suggesting the air itself is being ionized
